summary: This document is email correspondence between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding the redaction and release of Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy report in response to a FOIA request. The emails discuss coordination with the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) and specific redactions to autopsy photos.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email attaching the OCME Report of Autopsy and providing redaction guidance.

events.title: Initial Autopsy Report Distribution
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails the OCME Report of Autopsy for Jeffrey Epstein to colleagues, indicating planned redactions.

events.title: OCME Coordination on Redactions
events.description: Email discussion regarding specific redactions to autopsy photos, including a photo of Epstein's hyoid bone, following a conversation with the OCME General Counsel.

events.title: Redacted Report Release
events.description: Email forwarding the redacted autopsy report, noting it was included in a release to the Times.

keyFacts: The document is internal email correspondence about redacting and releasing Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy report under FOIA.
Specific discussion centers on redacting autopsy photos, including a photo of Epstein's hyoid bone on page 12.
The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) was consulted regarding the redactions.
The redacted report was released to The Times.
The correspondence shows procedural coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and OCME regarding sensitive post-mortem information.
